data.title: Prof. Dr. rer. nat. Gerhard Dehm
meta_keywords: Transmission electron microscopy (TEM) / Scanning electron microscopy (SEM) / Mechanical tests on the nanoscale / Semiconductor / Grain boundary engineering / Dislocations / Material defects / Atomistic modelling of Material Interfaces / Extreme Nanomechanics / Hydrogen mechanics / Interface chemistry / Thin films / Micromechanics / Synthesis / Intermetallic Materials / Material Characterization /
data.text:
Director

Main Focus

Advanced Methods of der Transmission Electron Microscopy

Experimental Methods of Micro- und Nanomechanics

In situ Electron Microscopy and X-ray diffraction

Interface and Defect Physics

Mechanical Properties of metallic Materials and Thin Films

Curriculum Vitae

Born in Ansbach (1965)

Study of Materials Sciences, Friedrich-Alexander Universit채t Erlangen (1986-1992)

PhD study at Max-Planck-Institute for Metals Research (Stuttgart) and University of Stuttgart (1992-1995)

PostDoc at Max-Planck-Institute for Metals Research, Stuttgart (1995-1996)

Guest Scientist at the Technion / Israel Institute of Technology, Haifa (1996-1998)

Scientist at Max-Planck-Institute for Metals Research, Stuttgart (1999-2005)

Director of the Erich Schmid Institute of Materials Science, Austrian Academy of Sciences, Leoben, Austria (2005-2012)

Full Professor (Chair and Head of Department) of Materials Physics, University of Leoben (2005-2012)

Director at the Max-Planck-Institut f체r Eisenforschung and Professor at the Ruhr-University Bochum (since 2012)

Honours and awards

ERC Advanced Grant Correlating the State and Properties of Grain Boundaries (2018)

Elected as Corresponding Member of the Austrian Academy of Sciences (2011)

Research Award of Styria for Nanosciences and Nanotechnology (2009)

Masing-Ged채chtnispreis, Deutsche Gesellschaft f체r Materialkunde e.V. (2002)

Feodor-Lynen-Fellowship of the Alexander von Humboldt Foundation (1996-1998)
